oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Readyville Mill: view from the northwest
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 5418 Murfreesboro Rd, Readyville, Cannon County, TN

Color photograph of a multi-story building with gray wooden siding and red double-hung windows. The view is from the northwest, showing the rear of the building west end wall. The front porch of the building is visible at right. The building rests on mortared limestone piers. Modern steel beams underpin the renovated building. The granary is visible in the right background.

The Readyville Mill was built in 1812 by Charles Ready, a wealthy landowner who was a founder of the Readyville community and lived nearby in his house, "The Corners". A dam constructed at the same time on the East Fork Stones River provided water to power the mill. At the time of its listing on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973, the mill was in operation, producing corn meal and flours. In its current (2013) form, the Readyville Mill complex consists of five restored buildings: mill, granary, icehouse, cabin, and smokehouse. The mill again produces meals and flours by utilizing an electric mill.
